description: External alterations comprising the cladding of the building with red brickwork at ground floor level and horizontal profiled metal cladding to the remaining levels, brick up to two openings, installation of wall/roof mounted lighting, installation of new metal framed windows to east elevation, new steel frame with polycarbonate canopy trolley parking area, a new freestanding steel entrance structure and metal framed glazed entrance doors to west elevation; provision of timber rail fence along boundary of the site and two lifting vehicle barriers to site entrances
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: [RHA1122-00001b, RHA1122-0010b, RHA1122-0011b, RHA1122-0013a, RHA1122-0015b, RHA1122-0016b, RHA1122-0017b, RHA1122-0018b, RHA1122-0019, RHA1122-0120c, RHA1122-0121c, RHA1122-0123c, RHA1122-0125e, RHA1122-0126b, RHA1122-0127c, RHA1122-0128a, RHA1122-0129c, RHA1122-0131d, RHA1122-0132b, RHA1122-0135 and e-mail dated 20/12/2011 from agent]  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | The proposed cladding of the building shall consist of Kingspan KS1000 MMR in colour RAL 9006 and shall be so maintained unless agreed with in writing through a submission of a planning application to the Local Planning Authority for any alterations that would materially affect the external appearance of the building before such works are commenced.  REASON: To ensure the development achieves adequate design, external appearance and number of units appropriate to the site and in accordance with adopted Unitary Development Plan policies 4.1, 4.7 and 5.5. | Prior to occupation, the applicant shall submit full details regarding tree replacement works, including a full programme of works, which shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON:  To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment 2004).
